CREATE TABLE `{$db_prefix}imdb_info` ( `id` int(11) NOT NULL, `url` varchar(200) NOT NULL, `title` varchar(200) NOT NULL, `year` year(4) DEFAULT NULL, `runtime` varchar(50) DEFAULT NULL, `genre` varchar(200) DEFAULT NULL, `releaseDate` varchar(100) DEFAULT NULL, `rating` float DEFAULT NULL, `votes` int(11) DEFAULT NULL, `poster` varchar(200) DEFAULT NULL, `plot` text, `plot_keywords` varchar(100) DEFAULT NULL, `mpaa` varchar(200) DEFAULT NULL, `aka` text, `seasons` varchar(200) DEFAULT NULL, `directors` varchar(200) DEFAULT NULL, `writers` varchar(200) DEFAULT NULL, `cast` text, `last_update` datetime NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8;

IMDB ID

Does an exact match of an integer of 7 digits Data Logic: equal

Genres

You can search multiple genres by comma separating them. Data Logic: OR

Year of Release

Does an exact match of any 4 digit long year. Data Logic: equal

Rating

Greater than the given rating. must be a float or integer. 0 > Rating > 10 Data Logic: greater than

Plot Keywords

Like Gnere, it finds all possible matches of given keywords Data Logic: OR

Directors

Finds all movies/shows of given Directors. Separate multiple of them with comma. Data Logic: AND

Writers

Finds all movies/shows of given Writers. Separate multiple of them with comma. Data Logic: AND

Also Known As (AKA)

Finds close matches of given titles. Useful to find shows in other languages. Data Logic: AND

All search strings must be at least 3 characters long
